full_summary:
## Government Tender Announcement

### Contract Information

* **Contract Title:** Wabush Service Upgrade - Wabush Airport, NL
* **Solicitation Number:** EC373-230778/A
* **Publication Date:** 2022-09-09
* **Tender Closing Date:** 2022-10-18T12:30:52
* **Contracting Entity:** Public Works and Government Services Canada
* **Estimated Contract Value:** $500,001 to $1,000,000

### Tender Description

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) invites bids for an Electrical Service Upgrade at the Wabush Airport in Wabush, Newfoundland and Labrador.

The work consists of furnishing all necessary plant, labor, equipment, and material for the electrical service upgrade and selective demolition of the distribution system at the Wabush Airport. Bidders must refer to R2710T (2022-01-28) GENERAL INSTRUCTIONS - CONSTRUCTION SERVICES - BID SECURITY REQUIREMENTS for the Integrity Provisions applicable to this requirement.

It is recommended that bidders visit the site to familiarize themselves with the existing conditions and determine materials needed, means of access, and temporary facilities required to perform the work. Prior permission from the Departmental Representative must be obtained before carrying out site inspection.

### Tender Requirements

Note that only electronic distribution of tenders and associated documents and/or construction drawings is available. Bidders must ensure that all amendments issued prior to closing have been obtained and addressed in the submitted bid.

Bids will be received in English or French at Public Works and Government Services Canada, Bid Receiving Unit, 10 Barter's Hill, P.O. Box 4600, St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador, A1C 5T2.

### Contact Information

* **Contracting Authority:** Alexandria Dwyer
* **Phone Number:** (709) 330-6330
* **Email Address:** Alexandria.Dwyer@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca
* **Fax Number:** (709) 772-4603

### Notice

In keeping with Canada's commitment to green procurement, this procurement is being conducted electronically. Bidders can download and print the documents or bring them or send them by email to a print shop or other professional printing services for printing.

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. Additionally, the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS
